Package swervelib.simulation.ironmaple.simulation

Class Goal

java.lang.Object
swervelib.simulation.ironmaple.simulation.Goal
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimulatedArena.Simulatable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CrescendoAmp, CrescendoSpeaker, ReefscapeBargeSimulation, ReefscapeProcessorSimulation, ReefscapeReefBranch
public abstract class Goal extends Object implements SimulatedArena.Simulatable

A abstract class to handle scoring elements in simulation.

  • Constructor Details

    • Goal

      public Goal(SimulatedArena arena, Distance xDimension, Distance yDimension, Distance height, String gamePieceType, Translation3d position, boolean isBlue, int max)

      Creates a goal object

      Parameters:
      arena - The host arena of this goal
      xDimension - The x dimension of the default box collider.
      yDimension - The y dimension of the default box collider.
      height - The height or z dimension of the default box collider.
      gamePieceType - the string game piece type to be handled by this goal.
      position - The position of this goal.
      isBlue - Wether this is a blue goal or a red one.
      max - How many pieces can be scored in this goal.

    • Goal

      public Goal(SimulatedArena arena, Distance xDimension, Distance yDimension, Distance height, String gamePieceType, Translation3d position, boolean isBlue)

      Creates a goal object with no scoring max.

      Parameters:
      arena - The host arena of this goal.
      xDimension - The x dimension of the default box collider.
      yDimension - The y dimension of the default box collider.
      height - The height or z dimension of the default box collider.
      gamePieceType - the string game piece type to be handled by this goal.
      position - The position of this goal.
      isBlue - Wether this is a blue goal or a red one.

      public static Rotation3d flipRotation(Rotation3d toFlip)

      Reverses a rotation so that the returned rotation points directly "behind" the original rotation.

      Parameters:
      toFlip - The rotation to be flipped.
      Returns:
      The flipped rotation.

    • simulationSubTick

      public void simulationSubTick(int subTickNum)

      Handles the update triggers for the goal object.

      Specified by:
      simulationSubTick in interface SimulatedArena.Simulatable
      Parameters:
      subTickNum - the number of this sub-tick (counting from 0 in each robot period)

    • setNeededAngle

      public void setNeededAngle(Rotation3d angle, Angle angleTolerance)

      Sets the angle to be used when checking game piece rotation.

      Parameters:
      angle - The angle that pieces should have when interacting with this goal
      angleTolerance - The tolerance to be used in checking said angle.

    • setNeededAngle

      public void setNeededAngle(Rotation3d angle)

      Sets the angle to be used when checking game piece rotation.

      Parameters:
      angle - The angle that pieces should have when interacting with this goal

    • checkValidity

      protected boolean checkValidity(GamePiece gamePiece)
      A high level call to check wether or not the provided piece is within this goals hit box and meets all requirements to be scored. For more information on how this function calculates see the functions:

      AbstractShape.contains(Vector2 point)

      Goal#checkHeight(GamePiece)

      checkRotation(GamePiece)

      checkVel(GamePiece)

      Be aware that due to the nature of the goal class the above functions may or may not have the same implementation for children of the goal class.

      Parameters:
      gamePiece - The game piece to be checked.
      Returns:
      Wether or not the game piece is within this goal.

    • checkRotation

      protected boolean checkRotation(GamePiece gamePiece)

      Checks wether or not the submitted game piece has a rotation able to be scored in this goal

      By default the rotation needed and tolerance may be set using the setNeededAngle(Rotation3d, Angle) function. However rotation checks may be handled differently by some children making this not apply. Additionally be aware that this function only supports pitch and yaw, not role. If support for roll is needed a custom implementation will have to be created.
      Parameters:
      gamePiece - The game piece to have its rotation checked.
      Returns:
      Wether or not the pieces rotation is consistent with rotation that are able to be scored in this goal.

    • checkCollision

      protected boolean checkCollision(GamePiece gamePiece)

      Returns wether or not the submitted game piece is within the goal.

      Parameters:
      gamePiece - The game piece to be checked.
      Returns:
      Wether or not the game piece is within the goal.

    • checkVel

      protected boolean checkVel(GamePiece gamePiece)

      Function to check wether the velocity of potential game pieces is acceptable.

      The default implementation of this function always returns true so any velocity checks will need to be implemented by children classes.
      Parameters:
      gamePiece - The game piece to have its velocity checked.
      Returns:
      Wether or not the pieces velocity is consistent with velocities that are able to be scored in this goal.

    • clear

      public void clear()

      Removes all game pieces from this goal

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()

      Returns wether or not this goal is full.

      Returns:
      wether or not the goal is full.

    • addPoints

      protected abstract void addPoints()

      Adds points when a piece has been successfully scored in this goal

      Since this function is the only trigger called when a piece is scored it may handle other small things outside of adding points.

    • draw

      public abstract void draw(List<Pose3d> drawList)

      Displays game pieces to advantage scope if applicable.

      Parameters:
      drawList - a list of Pose3d objects used to visualize the positions of the game pieces on AdvantageScope

    • getGamePieceCount

      public int getGamePieceCount()

      Returns the number of game pieces currently scored in this goal.

      Returns:
      This goals game piece count.
